TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed HttpVersionPolicy extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies behaviors for selecting and negotiating the HTTP version for a request.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Http.HttpVersionPolicy RequestVersionExact = int32(2)

remarks.format: ## Remarks This option allows for use of a prenegotiated clear text connection for the requested version.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Http.HttpVersionPolicy RequestVersionOrHigher = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Use the highest available version, downgrading only to the requested version but not below.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the server supports a higher version than the requested version (either negotiated via ALPN (H2) or advertised via Alt-Svc (H3)) and a secure connection is requested, the result is the highest available version. Otherwise, the version downgrades to <see cref="HttpRequestMessage.Version" />.
This option allows use of a prenegotiated clear text connection for the requested version but not for a higher version.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Http.HttpVersionPolicy RequestVersionOrLower = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Use the requested version or downgrade to a lower one. This is the default behavior.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the server supports the requested version, either negotiated via ALPN (H2) or advertised via Alt-Svc (H3), and a secure connection is being requested, the result is the <see cref="HttpRequestMessage.Version" />. Otherwise, the version downgrades to HTTP/1.1.
This option does not allow use of a prenegotiated clear text connection, for example, H2C.
